Class AddPartFormController

java.lang.Object
controller.AddPartFormController
All Implemented Interfaces:
javafx.fxml.Initializable
public class AddPartFormController extends Object implements javafx.fxml.Initializable
This class is the FXML Controller for the Add Part Form. The main purpose of the methods here are to read user data, make sure it fits, and then add it as a part to the main form's parts list. More time was spent in this section of the project than I expected. The variety of logical errors you have to account for with inputs is scary.

  • Method Details

    • onActionCancelNewPart

      void onActionCancelNewPart(javafx.event.ActionEvent event) throws IOException
      This method detects when the Cancel button is pressed and cancels the addition of a part. It lowers the count of the next ID to what it was before, and returns the user back to the main form.
      Parameters:
      event - The event of clicking the Cancel button.
      Throws:
      IOException

    • onActionInHouseNew

      void onActionInHouseNew(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
      This method changes the MachineID/CompanyName Label to Machine ID when the In House radio button is selected. It detects when the button is clicked and changes the text of the label.
      Parameters:
      event - The event of clicking the In House radio button.

    • onActionOutsourcedNew

      void onActionOutsourcedNew(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
      This method changes the MachineID/CompanyName Label to Company Name when the Outsourced radio button is selected. It detects when the button is clicked and changes the text of the label.
      Parameters:
      event - The event of clicking the Outsourced radio button.

    • onActionSaveNewPart

      void onActionSaveNewPart(javafx.event.ActionEvent event) throws IOException
      LOGICAL ERROR This method saves the new part to the Inventory Management System. It reads the text fields for user input, checks them for errors, and then saves the part if they are valid. One logical error I ran into occurred while writing this method. As I was testing whether or not certain inputs would cause an error, the ID used for the parts quickly incremented out of control. The problem was that the ID would get incremented even if an error was thrown and the part didn't save or if the cancel button was hit instead. In those situations, the ID of the next part shouldn't go up. I realized that I needed to keep of the next ID stored outside of this method, and decrement the next ID if the part was canceled or an error was thrown.
      Parameters:
      event - The event of clicking the Save button.
      Throws:
      IOException

    • initialize

      public void initialize(URL url, ResourceBundle rb)
      Initializes the controller class for the Add Part Form. It increases the index of the next part, as this method starting up indicates we are making that part. It sets the ID field to that ID as well.
      Specified by:
      initialize in interface javafx.fxml.Initializable
      Parameters:
      url - The URL used to initialize
      rb - The ResourceBundle used to initialize.
